ovdesc.p: The table is used to record Exceptions raised during Provision processing.
Currently, exception is raised in the following scenario:

When the asset classification reaches the WRITE.OFF stage and the Underlying contract of the PD (the Parent LD/MG record) is not liquidated, system will not be able to FWOF the contract automatically and it raises an exception Log.
Records cleared based on the days set in EXC.PURGE.DAYS set in ASSET.CLASS.PARAMETER.

desc.p: Actual routine within the Batch process which raised this Exception Log.
The PD contract ID which triggered this exception.

The date on which the Exception was raised. This field is also used by the system to check if the record had reached the maximum limit of purge days set on EXC.PURGE.DAYS stated in ASSET.CLASS.PARAMETER.
The actual Exception log message is stored in this Field. The field is Multi-valued to store multiple lines of Exception message.
The account officer of the contract which triggered this exception would be recorded in this field.
Should be a valid key to DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER file.
Application Product for which Exception log is raised.
The Batch process which raised this Exception log.
The base file name which caused the exception log. Corrections should be carried out on this file Manually.
For Provision, this file would be PD.PAYMENT.DUE.
